statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: D'walyn Roberts tipped in a rebound with 3.8 seconds left to give Texas Tech a 72-71 win over Nebraska on Saturday night.
article.headline: Texas Tech pulls out victory against Nebraska
article.linkText: Texas Tech pulls out victory against Nebraska
article.story: LUBBOCK, Texas -- D'walyn Roberts tipped in a rebound with 3.8 seconds left to give Texas Tech a 72-71 win over Nebraska on Saturday night. The win ended a four-game skid for the Red Raiders (9-11, 1-4 Big 12). Brandon Richardson put Nebraska up 71-70 with 11.4 seconds remaining after hitting three free throws after being fouled on a 3-point attempt. Texas Tech's Mike Singletary took the ball up the court and drove into the lane and missed, but Roberts tipped the ball in for the win. Nebraska tried a desperation shot at the end but it was off the mark. John Roberson scored a season-high 25 points for the Red Raiders, including a career-high seven 3s, for Texas Tech. Singletary had 14 points on 5-of-13 shooting. Richardson scored 20 points to lead the Cornhuskers (14-5, 2-3). He hit both 3s he tried and was flawless on eight free-throw attempts.
